alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin; Shelby; Spencer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:20AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SPENCER...SHELBY... NORTHWESTERN ANDERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 120 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shelbyville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Simpsonville, Montclair, Wayside, Glensboro, Avenstoke, Bridgeport, Hatton, Harrisonville and Hooper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
